intro: Sphaeralcea lindheimeri, commonly known as Lindheimer's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spherical, woolly seed pods and showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky areas or along stream banks. Sphaeralcea lindheimeri is adapted to arid environments and is considered a drought-tolerant species.
